A society where mental illnesses are eradicated would have a significantly higher productivity rate, as people would no longer be held back by their mental health issues. This could lead to a boost in the economy and a decrease in healthcare costs.

The stigma surrounding mental illnesses would be eliminated, leading to a more accepting and supportive society. This could lead to a decrease in the number of people suffering from mental illnesses due to social isolation and a lack of support.

With a cure for all mental illnesses, people would be able to live their lives to the fullest, without the limitations imposed by their mental health issues. This could lead to a society where people are more fulfilled and satisfied with their lives.

The cure for mental illnesses could lead to a decrease in the number of people using mental health services, such as therapy and medication. This could lead to a decrease in the cost of mental health services and a decrease in the burden on the healthcare system.

A cure for mental illnesses could lead to a decrease in the number of people committing suicide. This could lead to a decrease in the number of people suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and other mental health issues that can be triggered by traumatic events.
